sentences.en: A change in the pattern of his breathing became apparent.
sentences.cn: 他的呼吸方式明显起了变化。

sentences.en: A timeless comic actor—his simplicity and his apparent ease are matchless.
sentences.cn: 作为喜剧界的常青树——他的简单淳朴与自然大方无人能及。

sentences.en: He did well in his exams, despite his apparent lack of interest in his work.
sentences.cn: 他考得很好，尽管表面上他对功课不感兴趣。

sentences.en: He left suddenly, for no apparent reason .
sentences.cn: 不知什么原因，他突然离开了。

sentences.en: He was seen as Mr Olsen's heir apparent.
sentences.cn: 他被视为奥尔森先生理所当然的继任者。

sentences.en: His guilt is apparent to all.
I was a bit depressed by our apparent lack of progress.
sentences.cn: 我对我们看似缓慢的进展感到有些沮丧。

sentences.en: It rapidly became apparent that rock'n'roll was a very broad church indeed.
sentences.cn: 摇滚乐实际无所不包，这一点很快就显而易见了。

sentences.en: It was apparent from her face that she was really upset.
sentences.cn: 从面容上一眼就可以看出她确实心绪烦乱。

sentences.en: Journalists are frustrated by his apparent greyness.
sentences.cn: 他毫无个人魅力可言，这让记者们很失望。

sentences.en: Management hostility is apparent in about a third of non-union workplaces.
sentences.cn: 在大约1/3不雇用工会会员的工作场所明显可见仇视管理层的现象。

sentences.en: She received the news with apparent unconcern.
sentences.cn: 她接到这消息时显然无动于衷。

sentences.en: The apparent truth was really a lie.
sentences.cn: 表面上看似实话,实际上是个谎言.

sentences.en: The difference in quality was immediately apparent .
The difference in quality was immediately apparent.
The person may become dizzy for no apparent reason.
sentences.cn: 这类人可能会莫名其妙地感到头晕。

sentences.en: The presence of a star is already apparent in the early film.
sentences.cn: 在早期影片中已经显露出了明星相。

sentences.en: Their affluence is more apparent than real.
sentences.cn: 他们的富有是虚有其表.

phrases.tran_cn: 视运动；表观运动；虚表运动
表观细度；形式大小；表观尺寸，视尺寸
[律]法定继承人，有确定继承权的人

trans.tran_cn: 明显的，显而易见的，表面上的
